page.title: 08POLITICS IN IRELAND
page.content: There are four floors in the building. Two of them are occupied by the Assembly members. The other two floors are used by the D.O.E. At the head of the stairs leading to the first floor there is a statue of Lord Craigavon, the first prime minister of N.I. He is buried along with his wife in the grounds to the east of the buildings. Not far from the Parliment Buildings there are a number of large buildings which are occupied by the Civil Service of N.I. Extensive playing fields and a huge pavilion cater for the sporting needs of the Civil Service personnel.
